source_sentence: 爾時有一家為非人所害，唯有父子二人。
translation: At the time, there was a family that hadn't been harmed by someone but only father and son.

source_sentence: 父作是念：「我家喪破，恐殃未已，且復飢窮，當於何處得免斯患？」
translation: The father thought, My home has been destroyed, and I'm afraid the misfortune won't end. And where will I be able to escape this trouble if I go hungry?

translation: Again, he thought, The ascetic or Śākyamuni has many offerings and medicines for illness, so now I can send my child to leave home and receive the full set of precepts.

source_sentence: 念已，往到僧坊白諸比丘：「與我出家受具足戒。」
translation: After he thought this, he went to the saṃgha's quarters and said to the monks, Give me the full set of precepts to leave home.

source_sentence: 諸比丘便與出家受具足戒。
translation: The monks then gave the renunciant to receive the full set of precepts.

source_sentence: 入城乞食，一手抱兒，一手擎鉢。
translation: He entered the city to solicit alms, carrying a child in one hand and an almsbowl in the other.

translation: The only one able to cure these ailments is the senior citizen, and there is no other who can do so.

source_sentence: 而瓶沙王有令，勅耆域言：「汝當治我宮內及比丘、比丘尼病，不得治餘人！」
translation: The king of Vaiśravaṇa had an order, saying to the Jīvaka, You must treat the illnesses of my palace and the monks and bhikṣuṇīs in my room, but you won't treat the others!

source_sentence: 由是諸病人皆求出家受具足戒，諸比丘皆與出家受具足戒，為索藥草，
translation: Because of this, all the sick people asked to renounce household life and receive the full set of precepts. The monks gave their renunciants permission to receive the full set of precepts in order to ask for medicine and herbs.

source_sentence: 和合煮擣，多事多務，妨廢行道。
translation: It is a mixture of cooked rice and cooked rice. There are many duties and occupations that obstruct the way of traveling.

translation: If there's no ascetic practice, it destroys the ascetic teaching!

source_sentence: 復有一長者，頓得七種重病，往語耆域：「為我治之。」
translation: Again, there was an elderly man who suddenly became seriously ill with seven kinds of illnesses and went to Jīvaka and said, Healed for me.

source_sentence: 答言：「汝豈不聞王有令乎？」
translation: He replied, Haven't you heard that the king has an order?

source_sentence: 長者復言：「密為我治，當雇汝百千金錢。」
translation: The elder again said, I'll hire you for a hundred thousand pieces of money to cover it up for me.

source_sentence: 答之如初。
translation: The answer is as before.

source_sentence: 長者復加二百、三百、四百、五百、千金錢，乃至合家財物，及於妻子悉為奴婢。
translation: The wealthy man then added another two hundred, three hundred, four hundred, five hundred, and a thousand coins, which amounted to the property of the house and all his wives as slaves and maids.

source_sentence: 答亦如初。
translation: The answer is the same as the first.

source_sentence: 彼長者復作是念：「如此不果，唯當出家受具足戒。」
translation: Again, the elder thought, If this doesn't work, he'll only leave home and receive the full set of precepts.

source_sentence: 便往僧坊白諸比丘：「與我出家受具足戒。」
translation: He went to the saṃgha hall and said to the monks, Give me the full set of precepts for leaving home.

source_sentence: 諸比丘即與出家受具足戒。
translation: The monks then gave the renunciant to receive the full set of precepts.

source_sentence: 耆域為治七日都差，不復得治王宮人，宮人病已有死者。
translation: Jīvaka treated him for seven days and he was completely cured, but he could no longer treat the king's palace staff, who were sick and already dead.

source_sentence: 彼長者既差，即便還俗。
translation: The wealthy man was dismissed and returned to secular life.

source_sentence: 耆域見，問言：「汝已出家，何以罷道？」
translation: Seeing this, Jīvaka asked, You've left home, so why are you leaving the path?

source_sentence: 答言：「我本無出家意，以汝不肯為我治病，故權出家。
translation: He replied, I didn't originally want to leave home because you won't treat my illness for me, so I have the right to leave home.

source_sentence: 病既已差，是故還俗。」
translation: Since his illness has been healed, he's therefore returned to the secular world.

translation: Jīvaka then went to the Buddha and told him in detail, If you know this, it's not a great sin for me!

translation: May it be that Buddhist monks shouldn't save the seriously ill!

source_sentence: 佛為耆域說種種妙法，遣還所住。
translation: The Buddha taught various wonderful teachings to the Jīvaka, and they were sent back to where they lived.

source_sentence: 佛問諸比丘：「汝等實度重病人不？」

translation: Again, King Ajātaśatru had a strong general with the strength of a thousand men. The people called him Thousand Man soldiers because they were disgusted with the sufferings of the evil world and thought:

source_sentence: 我當往彼出家以盡苦源。」
translation: I will go there and leave home to end the source of suffering.

source_sentence: 即到僧坊求度，諸比丘即便度之。
translation: He went to the monastery to seek salvation, and the monks were able to save him.

translation: Later, when the king wanted to leave his army and didn't see this man, he asked where he belonged.

source_sentence: 所屬白王：「不知所在。」
translation: The attendants said to the king, I don't know where he is.

source_sentence: 王便令曰：「若軍集不至，當以軍法罪之！」
translation: The king then ordered them, If the army doesn't arrive, they'll be punished by military law!

source_sentence: 至軍集日復問：「彼人來未？」
translation: On the day when the army gathered, he again asked, Has that person come?

source_sentence: 答言：「未來！」
translation: He replied, In the future!

source_sentence: 王言：「步軍無此人，猶如象軍無第一象。」
translation: The king said, There's no such person in the infantry, just as there's no first elephant in the elephant army.

source_sentence: 軍甲既解，方聞沙門釋子度令出家，王便瞋言：「如是不久，沙門當度我兵盡！」
translation: When the army had dismounted, he heard that the ascetic and Śākyamuni had been liberated and ordered to leave home, and the king became angry and said, Soon, it won't be long before the ascetic will liberate my troops!

source_sentence: 王即立嚴制：「若復有度官人者，當折其和尚肋骨，截其阿闍梨舌，與餘僧重生革沙鞭八下，

translation: They'll be expelled from the border.

translation: The elder monks and nuns heard various kinds of rebuke and therefore reported it to the Buddha.

translation: It was then that the monks stayed in Rājagṛha for a long time. The householders criticized them, saying:

source_sentence: 四時不動，與世人何異？」
translation: What's the difference between the four times when he doesn't move and worldly people?

translation: The monks therefore reported this to the Buddha.

translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, You may proclaim to the monks that the Tathāgata will now travel south, and if he wants to follow them, he'll go with them at will.

source_sentence: 阿難受教遍宣此旨。
translation: Ānanda received the teaching and universally proclaimed this teaching.

source_sentence: 諸比丘中有一歲至九歲，聰明慚愧欲學戒者，作是念：「若我和尚、阿闍梨去者當從，
translation: Among the monks, there were some who were one year old and up to nine years old. The bold and shameful bhikṣus who wanted to learn the precepts had this thought:

source_sentence: 不去則止。
translation: If he doesn't go, then he stops.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 若我此請依止，彼當復請，則多事多務，妨廢行道。」
translation: If I ask them to rely on this, and they will also ask me to do so, then there are many things and many duties that obstruct the path of practice.

source_sentence: 佛既發行，從者甚少。
translation: Since the Buddha had issued it, there were very few who followed it.

source_sentence: 佛與少比丘遊行南方，漸漸還王舍城。
translation: The Buddha and the young bhikṣus traveled to the south and gradually returned to Rājagṛha.

source_sentence: 佛以是事集比丘僧，問阿難言：「從我南行比丘何以太少？」
translation: Because of this, the Buddha gathered the monks and asked Ānanda, Why are there so few monks traveling south from me?

translation: Ānanda answered with a detailed explanation, the Buddha variously praised the fulfillment of few desires and knowing contentment, praised precepts, and after praising observance of precepts, he told the monks, Accomplish five things to attain freedom from reliance: accomplishment of morality, accomplishment of concentration, accomplishment of wisdom, accomplishment of liberation, and accomplish

source_sentence: 皆如得授人戒中說。
translation: They're all as explained in the precepts that are given to people.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊在釋迦國，諸比丘度父母所不聽人，諸居士譏呵如上。
translation: When the Bhagavān was in the country of Śākyamuni, the monks liberated their parents and those who didn't listen to them, and the householders ridiculed them as above.

source_sentence: 於後世尊晨朝著衣持鉢到淨飯王宮。
translation: In the morning after that, the Bhagavān put on his robe and bowl in the morning and went to the palace of King Śuddhodana.

source_sentence: 時羅睺羅母，將羅睺羅在高樓上，遙見佛來，語言：「汝見彼沙門不？」
translation: The mother of Rāhula then took Rāhula to a high building and saw the Buddha coming from a distance, saying, Do you see that ascetic?

source_sentence: 答言：「見！」
translation: He replied, See!

source_sentence: 又語言：「彼是汝父，可往索父餘財。」
translation: Again, he said, That's your father; you can go and claim the rest of your father's property.

source_sentence: 佛既入宮，於中庭露地坐，羅睺羅馳下趣佛，頭面禮足，立佛影中，白言：「是影甚樂！
translation: When the Buddha entered the palace, he sat in the open air in the courtyard. Rāhula rushed down to where the Buddha was. After bowing his forehead at his feet, he stood in the shadow of the Buddha and said:

source_sentence: 願佛與我父餘財！」
translation: May the Buddha give me the rest of my father's wealth!

source_sentence: 佛語言：「汝審欲得不？」
translation: The Buddha said, Do you want to get it?

source_sentence: 答言：「欲得！」
translation: He replied, I want to get it!

source_sentence: 佛便將還所住，告舍利弗：「汝可度之。」
translation: The Buddha then returned to where he was staying and told Śāriputra, You can save him.

source_sentence: 舍利弗白佛：「世尊先制不得畜二沙彌，我已有周那，不復得度。」
translation: Śāriputra said to the Buddha, Bhagavān, The Bhagavān previously instructed me not to keep two novices; I already have Cunda and won't be able to save them again.

source_sentence: 佛言：「今聽如汝等能教誡者，畜二沙彌。」
translation: The Buddha said, Now, listen as you can teach and admonish those who keep two novices.

translation: You should make this kind of a distinction: first, you'll give the three refuges to the upāsaka and teach them, saying, I, Mr. A., take refuge in the Buddha, Dharma, and bhikṣus and saṃgha.

source_sentence: 如是三說。
translation: These are the three teachings.

source_sentence: 復教言：「我某甲，歸依佛已、歸依法已、歸依比丘僧已。」
translation: Again, he said, I, Mr. A., have relied on the Buddha, the Dharma, and the monks and nuns.

source_sentence: 亦三說。
translation: It's also explained in three ways.

source_sentence: 「我是佛婆伽婆優婆塞。」
translation: I am the Buddha Bhagavān Upāsaka.

source_sentence: 復應教言：「我某甲，盡壽不殺生、盡壽不盜、盡壽不邪婬、盡壽不妄語、盡壽不飲酒。」
translation: Again, you should teach, I, Mr. A., won't kill people for the rest of my life, won't steal for the rest of my life, won't commit sexual misconduct for the rest of my life, won't lie for the rest of my life, and won't drink alcohol for the rest of my life.

source_sentence: 復應教言：「我某甲，歸依佛、歸依法、歸依比丘僧。」
translation: Again, you should teach them, saying, I, Mr. A., take refuge in the Buddha, the Dharma, and the monks and nuns.

source_sentence: 如是三說。
translation: These are the three teachings.

source_sentence: 「我今於釋迦牟尼如來、應供、等正覺所，出家作沙彌，和尚某甲。」
translation: Now, I'll leave home and become a novice at the place where the Tathāgata Śākyamuni, Worthy of Offerings, and Completely Awakened One are staying, monk.

source_sentence: 即應語言：「盡壽不殺生，是沙彌戒；
translation: They should then say, “If one does not kill any living being for the rest of one’s life, this is a śrāmaṇer’s precept.

source_sentence: 盡壽不盜，是沙彌戒；
translation: Not stealing for the rest of one’s life is the Sramana precept.

source_sentence: 盡壽不婬，是沙彌戒；
translation: To live for the rest of one’s life and not abstain from sexual misconduct is the Sramana precept.

source_sentence: 盡壽不妄語，是沙彌戒；
translation: Not lying for the rest of one’s life is the Sramana precept.

source_sentence: 盡壽不飲酒，是沙彌戒；
translation: Not drinking alcohol for the rest of one’s life is the Sramana precept.

source_sentence: 盡壽不歌舞作倡伎樂，不往觀聽，是沙彌戒；
translation: For the rest of one’s life neither singing, dancing, playing music or singing, nor going and listening to music. This is the Sramana precept.

source_sentence: 盡壽不著華香塗身，是沙彌戒；
translation: For the rest of one’s life not wearing a body coated with flowers or fragrant odors is the śrāmaṇer precept.

source_sentence: 盡壽不坐臥高大床上，是沙彌戒；
translation: To spend the whole of one’s life not sitting or lying on a high, wide bed is the Sramana precept.

source_sentence: 盡壽不受畜金銀及錢，是沙彌戒；
translation: Not accepting to store gold, silver and coin for the rest of one’s life is the Sramana precept.

source_sentence: 盡壽不過時食，是沙彌戒。」
translation: For the rest of one's life, he doesn't eat at the right time; this is the śrāmaṇer precept.

source_sentence: 是為沙彌十戒。
translation: These are the ten precepts for novices.

source_sentence: 時淨飯王聞佛已度羅睺羅，便大懊惱，出詣佛所，白佛言：「佛昔出家，
translation: When King Śuddhodana heard that the Buddha had liberated Rāhula, he was greatly distressed. He went to see the Buddha and said to him:

source_sentence: 尚有難陀，不能令我如今懊惱。
translation: There's still a nanda who can't cause me to be distressed now.

source_sentence: 難陀已復出家，餘情所寄唯在此子。
translation: Nanda has already renounced the householder’s life. The only thing that is entrusted to him by other emotions is this child.

source_sentence: 今復出家，家國大計永為斷絕，未能忘情，何能自忍？」
translation: Now that you've renounced home again, the great idea of family and state is permanently cut off, so how can you tolerate it yourself if you can't forget your feelings?

source_sentence: 王又推己而白佛言：「子孫之愛徹過骨髓。
translation: The king pushed himself further and said to the Buddha, Sons and grandsons' love penetrates beyond bone marrow.

source_sentence: 如何諸比丘誘竊人子，而度為道？
translation: How did the monks tempt and steal people and convert them into the Way?

source_sentence: 願佛從今勅諸比丘，父母不聽不得為道！」
translation: May the Buddha command the monks from now on that their parents won't listen to them and won't follow the path!

source_sentence: 佛為王說種種妙法，示教利喜已，辭退還宮；
translation: The Buddha expounded various wonderful teachings to the king. Having shown him how to benefit and delight in these teachings, he withdrew and returned to his palace.

source_sentence: 即以是事集比丘僧，問諸比丘：「父母不聽，汝等實度與受具足戒不？」
translation: He then gathered the monks and asked the monks for this reason, Did you really save them and receive the full set of precepts if their parents didn't listen?

source_sentence: 答言：「實爾。
translation: He replied, Indeed.

source_sentence: 世尊！」
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 佛種種訶責已，告諸比丘：「從今父母不聽不得度！」
translation: After the Buddha had reprimanded them in various ways, he told the monks, From now on, parents won't allow you to save them!

source_sentence: 亦如上說。
translation: It's also as explained above.

source_sentence: 爾時王舍城有大富長者，信樂佛法，常飯食比丘、比丘尼、優婆塞、優婆夷；
translation: At that time in the city of Rājagaha there was a great wealthy man who believed in the buddha-dharma and always fed monks, bhikṣuṇīs, laymen, and laywomen.

source_sentence: 後為非人所害，唯二小兒在，遂大貧窮，恒拾殘食。
translation: Later, he was not harmed by anyone but the two small children who lived there. As a consequence they became very poor and constantly collected food leftovers.

source_sentence: 二兒先數見諸比丘故，遙見比丘便走往趣，為捉衣鉢，坐比丘膝上。
translation: The two children had seen the bhikṣus several times before. Seeing the bhikṣus from a distance, they ran away and went to their respective destinations. In order to catch the bhikṣus’ robes and almsbowl, they sat on the bhikṣus’ knees.

source_sentence: 諸比丘恐污衣鉢，輒避遠去。
translation: The monks were afraid to stain their robes and bowls, so they fled from a distance.

source_sentence: 諸居士見，譏訶言：「此家先富，一切沙門無日不往。
translation: Seeing this, the householders criticized him, saying, “This family was formerly wealthy. All the śramaṇas and brāhmaṇas would never fail to go here.

source_sentence: 今見孤窮，便捨遠避，不知恩養，唯食是親。
translation: Now, seeing that they're orphaned and helpless, they abandon their distant shelter and don't know how to support them, except by feeding their relatives.

source_sentence: 無沙門行，破沙門法！」
translation: If there's no ascetic practice, it destroys the ascetic teaching!

source_sentence: 諸長老比丘聞，種種訶責，以是白佛。
translation: When the elder monks heard this, they reprimanded him in various ways and reported it to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 佛問諸比丘：「汝等實爾不？」
translation: The Buddha asked the monks, Are you really that?

source_sentence: 答言：「實爾。
translation: He replied, Indeed.

source_sentence: 世尊！」
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 佛種種訶責已，問阿難：「彼二小兒為已幾歲？
translation: After the Buddha had reprimanded them in various ways, he asked Ānanda, How old are those two children?

source_sentence: 能於食上驅烏未？」
translation: Can you drive the crow over food?

source_sentence: 答言：「已能！
translation: He replied, Yes!

source_sentence: 大者八歲，小者七歲。」
translation: The large is eight years old, and the small is seven years old.

source_sentence: 佛告諸比丘：「今聽度小兒，乃至能驅烏者。」
translation: The Buddha told the monks, Now, we'll listen to the small children and even those who can drive out the crow.

source_sentence: 諸比丘既度二小兒已，恒教驅食上烏，而不與正食。
translation: After they had delivered the two children, the monks always taught them to drive up the crow and feed it, but they didn't give him proper food.

source_sentence: 諸居士見：「此諸沙門，常讚歎施平等食；
translation: The householders saw this and said, “These śramaṇas always praised the practice of giving food equally.

source_sentence: 而今度二小兒，但令驅烏，不與正食。」
translation: Now, he's liberating two small children but ordering them to drive out the crow and not give them proper food.

source_sentence: 諸長老比丘聞，以是白佛。
translation: When the elder monks heard this, they reported it to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 佛言：「如上座所得食分，亦應以此與沙彌；
translation: The Buddha said: Just as with the portion of food obtained by a superior monk, you should also give it to him.

source_sentence: 驅烏小兒，亦應等與。」
translation: A small child who drives a crow should also be given equally.

source_sentence: 爾時有一摩納害母，思惟罪重，常有悔懼，不知云何得滅此罪？
translation: At the time, there was a man named Mānava who harmed his mother and contemplated the seriousness of his sins, always remorseful and fearful, not knowing how to extinguish this sin.

source_sentence: 念言：「沙門釋子等行正法，淨修梵行，我若於彼出家，罪應微輕。」
translation: He thought, Śākyamunis and other ascetics who practice the right teaching and purely cultivate the religious practice should be slightly offended if I leave home there.

source_sentence: 便到僧坊白諸比丘：「與我出家受具足戒。」
translation: He then went to the saṃgha hall and said to the monks, Give me the full set of precepts for leaving home.

source_sentence: 諸比丘問：「摩納！
translation: The monks asked, Mānava!

source_sentence: 汝外道不敬信佛法，今何故欲於中出家？」
translation: You non-Buddhists don't respect the Buddha's teaching, so why would you want to leave home here now?

source_sentence: 便以實答。
translation: He then answered with a true answer.

source_sentence: 諸比丘不知云何？
translation: The monks didn't know what it was.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「害父母人於我法中不復生，不應與出家受具足戒，
translation: Because of this, he said to the Buddha, Whoever harms his parents won't be born again in my Dharma. They shouldn't leave home and receive the full set of precepts.

source_sentence: 若已受具足戒應滅擯。」
translation: If someone has received the full set of precepts, they should cease anger.

source_sentence: 爾時有阿練若賊，殺一住阿練若處比丘，從是已後，心常惱熱，猶如熱灰自炮其身，
translation: At the time, there was an aryan thief who killed one monk living in a forest dwelling place. After that, his mind always became agitated and feverish, like hot ashes shedding themselves onto his body.

source_sentence: 晝夜苦痛無有暫寧，作是念：「沙門釋子等行正法，淨修梵行，我若於彼出家，
translation: Day and night, painful and unremitting, he thought, “The śramaṇas and brāhmaṇas practice the right Dharma and purify their religious practice.

source_sentence: 可得離此熱惱。」
translation: You can be freed from this burning affliction.

source_sentence: 念已，即到僧坊求出家。
translation: After he thought this, he went to the saṃgha's quarters and asked to leave home.

source_sentence: 諸比丘語言：「汝是阿練若賊，恒欲殺人，奪人財物，無憐愍心。
translation: The monks said, You're an aryan thief who always wants to kill people and steal their possessions with no compassion.

source_sentence: 今何故欲於佛法律中出家？」
translation: Why do you now want to leave home in the Buddha's teaching?

source_sentence: 便以實答。
translation: He then answered with a true answer.

source_sentence: 諸比丘不知云何？
translation: The monks didn't know what it was.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「彼比丘是阿羅漢，此人於我法中不復生，不應與出家受具足戒，
translation: Because of this he said to the Buddha, “That bhikṣu is an arhat. This bhikṣu will not be reborn in my country and should not be allowed to renounce the householder’s life or receive higher ordination.

source_sentence: 若已受具足戒應滅擯。」
translation: If someone has received the full set of precepts, they should cease anger.

source_sentence: 爾時調達惡心出佛身血，諸比丘不知云何待遇？
translation: It was then that the bad-minded Tathāgata bled blood from the Buddha's body, and the monks didn't know how to treat it.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「惡心出佛身血，於我法中不復生，不應與出家受具足戒，
translation: Because of this, he said to the Buddha, “With a malicious mind I bled the blood of the Buddha’s body. He will not be reborn in my Dharma.

source_sentence: 若已受具足戒應滅擯。」
translation: If someone has received the full set of precepts, they should cease anger.

source_sentence: 調達破僧不應與出家亦如是。
translation: It's likewise with a tathāgata who breaks the saṃgha and doesn't allow him to leave home.

source_sentence: 爾時佛遊拘薩羅國，與大比丘僧千二百五十人俱，漸漸遊行到黑闇河邊，
translation: At that time the Buddha was staying in Kosala. Accompanied by one thousand two hundred and fifty bhikṣus, he gradually journeyed to the edge of the Black River of darkness.

source_sentence: 止娑羅林下。
translation: He stopped at the foot of the sal trees.

source_sentence: 有一比丘從坐起偏袒右肩，右膝著地，合掌，白佛言：「世尊！
translation: A certain monk rose from his seat, bared his right shoulder, knelt with his right knee on the ground, joined his palms, and said to the Buddha:

source_sentence: 此娑羅林是破眾多比丘尼梵行處。」
translation: This śāla forest is a place where many monks and nuns violate the religious practice.

source_sentence: 佛問：「汝云何知？」
translation: The Buddha asked, How do you know?

source_sentence: 答言：「我時在此！」
translation: He replied, I'm here now!

source_sentence: 又問：「汝破比丘尼梵行耶？」
translation: Again, he asked, Have you broken the religious practice of monks and nuns?

source_sentence: 答言：「如是！」
translation: He replied, So it is!

source_sentence: 佛告諸比丘：「婬比丘尼人，於我法中不復生，不應與出家受具足戒，
translation: The Buddha said to the bhikṣus: Monks and nuns who have sexual intercourse should not be reborn in my religion. They should not be allowed to renounce household life and receive higher ordination.

source_sentence: 若已受具足戒應滅擯。」
translation: If someone has received the full set of precepts, they should cease anger.

source_sentence: 爾時有一阿修羅子厭生老病死，作是念：「沙門釋子等行正法，淨修梵行。
translation: At the time, there was an asura boy who became disillusioned with birth, old age, illness, and death and thought, These ascetics and Śākyamunis practice the right teaching and purify the religious practice.

source_sentence: 我當於彼出家，盡諸苦源。」
translation: I will leave home there and end the source of suffering.

source_sentence: 念已，化作人形往僧坊求出家，諸比丘即與受具足戒，食一人分食，乃至七人分食，
translation: Having thought of this, he transformed himself into a human being and went to the monastery to seek renouncing the householder’s life. The bhikṣus then gave him food for one person [to receive] the full set of precepts, up to seven people who received food for equal portions.

source_sentence: 猶故不飽；
translation: They are not satisfied because they do not eat.

source_sentence: 復食僧殘食，亦復不足。
translation: Again, he ate the leftover food of the saṃgha, but it wasn't enough.

source_sentence: 時王舍城有二居士，同日各請五百僧。
translation: At the time, there were two laymen in Rājagṛha who invited five hundred monks to each of them on the same day.

source_sentence: 諸比丘同往一家，唯化比丘獨至一處，須臾食五百人分盡。
translation: The monks all went to a house together, but the apparitional monk went alone to one place, and five hundred of them were eaten up in an instant.

source_sentence: 諸居士譏訶言：「云何諸比丘度非人？」
translation: The monks criticized them, saying, How did the monks save non-people?

source_sentence: 彼比丘覺人知已，忽便還本。
translation: Knowing this, the monk suddenly returned to his own place.

source_sentence: 諸長老比丘聞，以是白佛。
translation: When the elder monks heard this, they reported it to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 佛言：「於我法中非人不生，不應與出家受具足戒，若已受具足戒應滅擯。
translation: The Buddha said, In my teaching, a person who doesn't arise shouldn't be allowed to leave home and receive the full set of precepts; if they have received the full set of precepts, they should cease anger.

source_sentence: 受具足戒時，應問：『汝是非人不？』」
translation: When you receive the full set of precepts, you should ask, 'Are you right or wrong person?'

source_sentence: 爾時善自在龍王厭生老病死，念欲出家，化作一摩納，乃至諸比丘度與受具足戒，
translation: It was then that the dragon king Suneśvara, disillusioned with birth, old age, illness, and death, thought of leaving home and transformed himself into a manas, even to the point where all the monks were liberated and given the full set of precepts.

source_sentence: 亦如上。
translation: It's likewise as above.

source_sentence: 龍法二時不能變形，行欲時、睡眠時。
translation: The dragon's dharma can't change form at two times, when he's engaged in desire and drowsiness.

source_sentence: 於後眠熟，身滿一屋，喘息聲如雷震，妨諸比丘坐禪，皆出往視。
translation: Later, as he was asleep and fully awake, his body filled one room with breathless sounds like thunder and lightning, preventing the monks from sitting in meditation. They all came out to look around.

source_sentence: 彼聞人聲便覺，還作比丘形結跏趺坐；
translation: Hearing the sound of the man’s voice, they awaken and return to sit cross-legged in the form of a bhikṣu.

source_sentence: 喚令開戶，彼即開戶，諸比丘問：「汝是誰？」
translation: He summoned them to open the door, and they opened it. The monks asked, Who are you?

source_sentence: 答言：「我是沙門釋子。」
translation: He replied, I'm the ascetic or Śākyamuni.

source_sentence: 又語：「汝莫妄語！」
translation: Again, he said, Don't speak falsely!

source_sentence: 彼化比丘便以實答。
translation: That transformation monk then answered in truth.

source_sentence: 諸比丘不知云何？
translation: The monks didn't know what it was.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「畜生於我法中不生，不應與出家受具足戒，若已受具足戒應滅擯。
translation: He therefore told the Buddha, who said, An animal that doesn't arise in my teaching shouldn't be allowed to leave home and receive the full set of precepts; if it has received the full set of precepts, it should cease anger.

source_sentence: 從今受戒，不相識者應七日試看。」
translation: From now on, they'll receive the precepts, and those who don't know each other should try to see them for seven days.

source_sentence: 爾時諸比丘度黃門與受具足戒，便呼諸沙彌及守園人共作不淨行，出外見人亦如是。
translation: It was then that the monks were liberated from the yellow gate and given the full set of precepts, and they called out to the novices and park guards to perform impure actions together, as did those who saw outsiders.

source_sentence: 諸白衣見，譏訶言：「沙門釋子度諸黃門，必當共作不淨事。
translation: Seeing this, the white-robed monks criticized him, saying, The ascetic or Śākyamuni who crosses over to the yellow gates will surely do unclean things together.

source_sentence: 此輩無可度、不可度！」
translation: These people have nothing to save and nothing to save!

source_sentence: 乃至「若已受具足戒應滅擯，亦如上說。
translation: It goes so far as to say, If someone has received the full set of precepts, they should cease anger, as explained above.

source_sentence: 受具足戒時應先問：『汝是丈夫不？』」
translation: When you receive the full set of precepts, you should first ask, 'Are you a husband?'

source_sentence: 二根亦如是。
translation: So it is with the two faculties.

source_sentence: 爾時有一家為非人所害，唯家主一人在，作是念：「我今窮餓，當作何方救全性命？
translation: At the time, there was a family that hadn't been harmed by anyone but the owner of the house who lived alone and thought, Now that I'm starving, where will I go to save my life?

source_sentence: 彼沙門釋子多得衣食、疾病醫藥，我今當自剃頭著袈裟住家中，恒往僧坊案次食。」
translation: That ascetic or Śāriputra often obtains clothing, food, and medicine for illness, so now I'll shave my head and put on the reddish-brown robes to stay at home and always go to the saṃgha hall to eat in order.

source_sentence: 念已，即自剃頭作比丘，往比丘住處覓食。
translation: After he thought this, he shaved his hair and made himself a monk, went to the monk's dwelling place to search for food.

source_sentence: 諸比丘禮皆受，亦禮諸比丘。
translation: The monks paid homage to each other and also saluted the monks.

source_sentence: 諸比丘問：「汝何故禮他，復受他禮？
translation: The monks asked, Why are you paying homage to others and accepting another's homage?

source_sentence: 汝為幾歲？
translation: How old are you?

source_sentence: 何時受戒？
translation: When did he receive the precepts?

source_sentence: 和尚、阿闍梨為是誰？」
translation: Who are the monks and preceptors?

source_sentence: 答言：「我自剃頭著法服，無有和尚、受戒年月。」
translation: He replied, I shaved my head and put on the Dharma robes, but there's no monk or nun who receives the precepts for years.

source_sentence: 諸比丘不知云何？
translation: The monks didn't know what it was.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「若自剃頭自稱比丘，於我法中不生，不應與出家受具足戒，
translation: He therefore said to the Buddha, If he shaved his hair and called himself a monk, he wouldn't be born in my teaching; he shouldn't be allowed to leave home and receive the full set of precepts.

source_sentence: 若已受具足戒應滅擯。」
translation: If someone has received the full set of precepts, they should cease anger.

source_sentence: 爾時跋難陀弟子尼揵比丘，昔罷道者，後復來求出家。
translation: It was then that the monk Nirgrantha, a disciple of Upananda who had abandoned the path in the past, came back and asked to leave home.

source_sentence: 諸比丘不知云何？
translation: The monks didn't know what it was.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「捨內法外道人，於我法中不生，不應與出家受具足戒，
translation: He therefore said to the Buddha, “If a heretic renounces the householder’s life outside of Buddhism, he will not be reborn in my religion. He should not be allowed to renounce family life and receive higher ordination.

source_sentence: 若已受具足戒應滅擯。」
translation: If someone has received the full set of precepts, they should cease anger.

source_sentence: 爾時孫陀羅難陀跋耆子，不捨戒行婬法，彼後自說所犯。
translation: It was then that Sundarananda Nanda Vajjiputta didn't abandon the precepts and practice sexual misconduct, and he later explained what he had violated.

source_sentence: 諸比丘不知云何？
translation: The monks didn't know what it was.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「若自說犯邊罪，於我法中不生，不應與受具足戒，
translation: He therefore said to the Buddha, “If you commit a minor offense by saying so yourself, it will not arise in my teaching. You should not be given the full set of precepts.

source_sentence: 若已受具足戒應滅擯。
translation: If someone has received the full set of precepts, they should cease anger.

source_sentence: 受戒時應問：『汝先出家淨修梵行不？』」
translation: When you receive the precepts, you should ask, 'Have you previously left home and purely cultivated the religious practice?'

source_sentence: 爾時諸比丘不受依止住，無人教誡，愚闇無知不能學戒。
translation: At the time, the monks didn't rely on them to abide, and there was no one to admonish them, ignorant and ignorant, who couldn't study the precepts.

source_sentence: 諸長老比丘，以是白佛。
translation: The elder monks and nuns therefore reported this to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 佛言：「應受依止，若一宿不受依止，乃至不聽飲僧坊內水；
translation: The Buddha said: They should receive support. If they do not receive support for one night, they will not even be allowed to drink water in the monastery halls.

source_sentence: 若飲，突吉羅。」
translation: If you drink it, it's a grave offense.

source_sentence: 佛既不聽不受依止，便不敢復住僧坊內。
translation: Since the Buddha didn't listen and don't rely, he didn't dare to stay inside the saṃgha's hall again.

source_sentence: 時有一比丘避住止處，往到佛所，頭面禮足，却坐一面。
translation: At that time a certain bhikṣu avoided the place where he was staying and approached the Buddha. After honoring him by bowing his forehead at [the Buddha’s] feet, he withdrew and sat to one side.

source_sentence: 佛問：「汝從何方來？」
translation: The Buddha asked, Where are you coming from?

source_sentence: 答言：「從某方來。」
translation: He replied, I came from a certain place.

source_sentence: 又問：「彼住處第一上座，第二、第三上座為誰？」
translation: Again, he asked, Who is the first superior seat in that dwelling place, and who are the second and third superior seats?

source_sentence: 答言：「不識。」
translation: He replied, I don't know.

source_sentence: 又問：「彼左右住處上座，復是誰？」
translation: Again, he asked, To whom is the superior seat where they live next to each other?

source_sentence: 答：「亦不識。」
translation: Answer, They don't know either.

source_sentence: 又問：「汝何故不識？」
translation: Again, he asked, Why don't you know it?

source_sentence: 答言：「我避住處，不入彼眾，是故不識。」
translation: He replied, I avoided the place where I lived and didn't enter that crowd; therefore, I don't know it.

source_sentence: 又問：「汝何故避住處？」
translation: Again, he asked, Why are you avoiding the dwelling place?

source_sentence: 答言：「佛不聽不受依止，若不受依止，乃至不聽飲僧坊內水，是故避之。」
translation: He replied, The Buddha won't listen and doesn't accept support, and if he doesn't accept support or doesn't even listen to the water inside the saṃgha's hall for drinking, that's why he avoids it.

source_sentence: 佛種種訶責彼比丘：「汝所作非法！
translation: The Buddha variously reprimanded that monk, What you've done is unlawful!

source_sentence: 不應為受依止故，避住處！」
translation: You shouldn't avoid the place where you live for the sake of receiving support!

source_sentence: 呵已，告諸比丘：「若為受依止避住處，突吉羅。」
translation: After he had rebuked them, he told the monks, If you take refuge in a place to avoid staying, it's a grave offense.

source_sentence: 復有諸比丘在道行見僧坊，便入受依止，值諸比丘坐禪或遇相瞋，不得受，
translation: Again, some monks who were on religious paths and saw the saṃgha’s quarters entered to receive their support. When they happened to see the monks sitting in meditation or became angry with each other, they would not allow them to do so.

source_sentence: 以此失伴；
translation: Because of these errors, they are accompanied by misfortune.

source_sentence: 或受依止已即去，諸比丘問：「汝何故受依止已即去？」
translation: Perhaps he leaves after receiving the support, and the monks ask, Why did you leave after receiving the support?

source_sentence: 答言：「世尊不聽為受依止避住處，我今見僧住止處，不敢不過受依止，
translation: He replied, Bhagavān, the Bhagavān won't allow me to take refuge in a place where I can avoid it. Now, when I see a place where the saṃgha lives and stays, I dare not accept anything but support.

source_sentence: 復應及伴，是以便去。」
translation: You should also go with your companions, so you can leave.

source_sentence: 彼失伴者，道中遇賊。
translation: If they lose their companions, they'll meet a thief in the path.

source_sentence: 諸長老比丘以是白佛，佛言：「今聽一宿不受依止。」
translation: The elder monks therefore reported this to the Buddha, who said, Now, listen for one night and won't accept my support.

source_sentence: 雖得一宿，猶有諸難。
translation: Even though he had obtained one lunar station, there were still some difficulties.

source_sentence: 復以白佛，佛言：「今聽不受依止，乃至六宿。」
translation: Again, he said to the Buddha, who said, Now, listen and don't rely on it for six nights.

source_sentence: 復有諸比丘過六宿不受依止，以是白佛，佛言：「不聽過六宿！
translation: Again, there were monks who didn't accept support for more than six nights and therefore said to the Buddha, Who said, Don't listen for more than six nights!

source_sentence: 過者，突吉羅。」
translation: A mistake is a grave offense.

source_sentence: 時諸比丘趣與人作依止，亦趣依止人。
translation: The monks then went to the place where they were supported by someone, and they also went to the place where they were supported.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「皆不應爾！
translation: He therefore said to the Buddha, and he said, None of them should do so!

source_sentence: 應依止長老如法比丘，善能教誡者。
translation: You should rely on an elder who's a monk who follows the teaching and is well able to admonish him.

source_sentence: 若受依止人欲移餘處，應先問和尚、阿闍梨，知彼有可依止人然後可往。」
translation: If someone who receives support wants to move to another place, they should first ask the monks and ācāryas if they have someone to rely on and then they can go there.

source_sentence: 有諸弟子臨行時辭和尚、阿闍梨。
translation: When some of the disciples were about to leave, they said to the monks and preceptors.

source_sentence: 佛言：「不聽臨行時辭，要先二、三日白師。
translation: The Buddha said, You won't be allowed to leave when you're about to leave; you must first tell your teacher two or three days beforehand.

source_sentence: 師應籌量所往處，有可依止人乃聽去。
translation: The teacher should examine where he's going, and if there's someone who can rely on him, then he'll be allowed to leave.

source_sentence: 到彼住處，應先禮塔，次禮上座，索房舍，然後求依止。」
translation: When you arrive at their dwelling place, you should first pay homage to the stūpa, next bow to the superior monk, ask for a dwelling, and then seek support.

source_sentence: 作依止比丘應問：「汝和尚、阿闍梨是誰？
translation: The monk who makes the support should ask, Who are you, monks and ācārya?

source_sentence: 先住何處？
translation: Where did you live before?

source_sentence: 誦何經？」
translation: What sūtra does he recite?

source_sentence: 答若如法，應與作依止；
translation: Answer: If it is according to the doctrine, one should give it as a basis.

source_sentence: 若不如法，應語言：「汝不識我，我不識汝，汝可往識汝處求依止。」
translation: If it's not according to the teaching, you should say, You don't know me; I don't know you; you can go and know where you are and seek support.

source_sentence: 若疑，應語：「小住。」
translation: If you doubt it, you should say, Small abode.

source_sentence: 受依止人應小住，乃至六宿觀之，合意者應與依止，若不合意應語如上。
translation: Those who receive support should live in a small abode up to the sixth constellation and observe it; those who are united with intention should give support, and if they aren't united with intention, they should speak as above.

source_sentence: 復有病比丘求依止，彼比丘作是念：「佛教比丘應如是如是視弟子。
translation: Again, there's a sick monk who asks for support, and that monk thinks, That Buddhist monk should thus and thus look at the disciple.

source_sentence: 今此人病，我不能看。」
translation: Now, this person is ill, and I can't look after him.

source_sentence: 便不與依止。
translation: They then won't give it to the support.

source_sentence: 病比丘不知云何？
translation: The sick monk didn't know what to do.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「今聽病時不受依止，病差然後受。」
translation: He therefore told the Buddha, who said, Now that he's listening to his illness, he won't accept it or rely on it, and then he'll accept it when his illness is cured.

source_sentence: 復有看病比丘求依止，彼比丘語言：「佛教比丘應如是如是視和尚、阿闍梨。
translation: Again, there was a sick monk who looked after the monks and asked for support, and those monks said, A Buddhist monk should thus and thus look at monks and Ajari.

source_sentence: 汝今看病，不得與汝依止。」
translation: Now, you're seeing a sickness, so you can't give it to your support.

source_sentence: 看病比丘不得依止，慚愧便捨病去，求依止。
translation: The sick bhikṣu who looked after the monk but could not provide support for him shamefully abandoned his illness and departed to seek refuge.

source_sentence: 病人無有看者，或更增劇、或有命過。
translation: A sick person who doesn't have someone to look after them might become even more serious or have a fault with life.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「今聽看病比丘不受依止，須病人差，然後受。」
translation: He therefore told the Buddha, who said, Now, listen to the monk who's sick and doesn't accept support; it's necessary for the patient to be cured before he receives it.

source_sentence: 復有諸比丘，於稱意行道得道果處，求依止，諸比丘不與，便失道果。
translation: Again, if there are monks who practice the path according to their aspirations and attain the fruit of the path and seek reliance on it, then those monks won't give it, and they'll lose the fruit of the path.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「若是稱意行道得道果處，無人與作依止者，聽於彼眾中上座、若上座等，
translation: Because of this, he said to the Buddha, saying, If someone practices the path according to their aspirations and attains the fruit of the path, no one will give them support or listen to those who are superior seated in the assembly, whether they're superior seated or superior seated.

source_sentence: 心生依止，敬如師法而住。」
translation: The mind gives rise to support and respectfully abides according to the teacher's teaching.

source_sentence: 時諸比丘阿闍梨，或喪、或罷道、或遠行、或作外道、或出界外，不知失依止不？
translation: At the time, did the monks and preceptors, whether they lost their lives, abandoned the path, traveled far away, became non-Buddhists, or left the boundary, not know or lose their support?

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「失依止有八種：若依止師遠行、若罷道、若死、若作外道；
translation: Because of this, he said to the Buddha: There are eight kinds of loss of support.

source_sentence: 若見先和尚；
translation: Suppose he meets a former monk.

source_sentence: 若依止師語：『汝更就某甲受依止。』
translation: If you rely on the teacher's words, 'Again, you'll accept a certain person's support.'

source_sentence: 若依止師出界經宿；
translation: If one relies on the teacher, he leaves the boundary and spends the night in the scriptures.

source_sentence: 若滿五歲，聰明辯才，至明相出時。
translation: If he's five years old, he'll be intelligent and eloquent until the time when his bright appearance emerges.

source_sentence: 是為八，皆失依止。」
translation: These are the eight, which all lose their support.

source_sentence: 爾時諸比丘與沙彌等分安居施物，沙彌便不敬僧。
translation: It was then that the monks and other parts of the novice's retreat were given to him, and the novice didn't venerate the saṃgha.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「應以一比丘分，與三沙彌。」
translation: He therefore told the Buddha, who said, You should share it with one monk and give it to three śrāmaṇeras.

source_sentence: 沙彌猶不恭敬，復以白佛，佛言：「應罰之！」
translation: Still disrespectful, the novice again reported to the Buddha, who said, You should punish him!

source_sentence: 諸比丘不問沙彌師便罰，師不悅。
translation: The monks didn't ask the novice teacher, and he then punished them, but the teacher wasn't pleased.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「應語其師。」
translation: He therefore said this to the Buddha, who said, You should tell your teacher.

source_sentence: 其師作非法助沙彌，以是白佛，佛言：「師不應非法助沙彌。」
translation: The teacher did something unlawful to assist the novice and therefore reported it to the Buddha, who said, A teacher shouldn't help a novice unlawfully.

source_sentence: 復有一沙彌，僧罰斷其食。
translation: Again, there was a novice whose food was cut off by the saṃgha as punishment.

source_sentence: 彼主人後請僧食，諸比丘往次第坐，主人不下食。
translation: The host then invited the saṃgha to eat, and the monks went in order to sit down, but the host didn't go down to eat.

source_sentence: 諸比丘言：「日時已至，何故不下食？」
translation: The monks said, Why don't you eat when the sun has arrived?

source_sentence: 答言：「須僧集！」
translation: He replied, It's necessary to gather the saṃgha!

source_sentence: 諸比丘言：「僧已集！」
translation: The monks said, The saṃgha has gathered!

source_sentence: 主人言：「我所供養沙彌未至。」
translation: The host said, My offerings to the novice haven't arrived yet.

source_sentence: 諸比丘言：「彼不得來！」
translation: The monks said, They won't come!

source_sentence: 問：「何故？」
translation: He asked, Why is that?

source_sentence: 答：「僧罰不與食。」
translation: Answer, The saṃgha is punished by not giving food.

source_sentence: 主人言：「餘罰不少，何忍斷其食？」
translation: The host said, There are so many other punishments, so how can we tolerate cutting off food?

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「不應斷食。
translation: He therefore told the Buddha, who said, You shouldn't cut off food.

source_sentence: 應罰掃地、除糞、輦石、治經行處、作階道，作如是等種種罰之。」
translation: They should be punished by sweeping the ground, removing dung and stones, treating the places where they walk up and down, building steps, and doing various kinds of punishments like this.

source_sentence: 時有一比丘男根滅女根生，諸比丘不知云何？
translation: One time, there was a monk whose male faculty ceased and the female faculty arose, but the monks didn't know what to do.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「應即以此受戒，即以此請師，即以此年歲往比丘尼住處，
translation: He therefore said to the Buddha, “You should receive the precepts for this reason. That is, by means of these precepts you should request a teacher who will go and live in that same monastery for one year.

source_sentence: 依比丘尼法住；
translation: They abide according to the ways of bhikṣus and nuns.

source_sentence: 若先犯共比丘尼戒，應於比丘尼中悔；
translation: If someone has previously violated the precepts for nuns accompanied by bhikṣus, they should repent among the bhikṣus and nuns.

source_sentence: 若先犯不共戒，不復悔。
translation: If someone previously violated the uncommon precepts, they won't repent again.

source_sentence: 比丘尼根變亦如是。」
translation: So it is with the transformation of the faculties of monks and nuns.

source_sentence: 有一式叉摩那根變，不知云何！
translation: There's a transformation of the śikṣamāna faculty, but I don't know what it is!

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「應即以此出家，若年滿二十，於比丘眾中十人與受具足戒；
translation: He therefore said to the Buddha: You should renounce household life because of this. If you have reached the age of twenty, ten members of the assembly of bhikṣus should be allowed to receive the full set of precepts for renunciation.

source_sentence: 若年未滿二十，即是沙彌。
translation: If he's under 20 years old, he's a novice.

source_sentence: 沙彌尼亦如是。」
translation: So it is with novices and nuns.

source_sentence: 有一沙彌根變，不知云何？
translation: There was a novice whose faculties were transformed, but he didn't know what it was.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「應即以此出家，若年滿，應與二歲戒，即於比丘尼眾受二歲戒；
translation: He therefore said to the Buddha, “You should renounce household life because of this. If you are old enough to receive the ordination for two years, you should accept the ordination for two years from all the bhikṣus and nuns in the assembly of monks and nuns.

source_sentence: 若年未滿不應與二歲戒，即是沙彌尼。」
translation: If someone under the age of two shouldn't be given the precepts, that's a novice nun.

source_sentence: 爾時有一比丘為欲火所燒，不能堪忍，自截其形。
translation: It was then that a monk was burned by the fire of desire and unable to bear it, cutting off his own form.

source_sentence: 諸比丘以是白佛，佛訶責言：「汝愚癡人！
translation: The monks therefore reported this to the Buddha, who reprimanded them and reprimanded them, saying, You foolish man!

source_sentence: 不應截而截，應截便不截！」
translation: What shouldn't be cut is cut, and what should be cut isn't cut!

source_sentence: 告諸比丘：「若截頭及半，突吉羅；
translation: He told the monks, If you cut off your head and a half, it's a grave offense.

source_sentence: 若都截，偷羅遮；
translation: If they are all cut off, it is a pārājika.

source_sentence: 若去一卵，偷羅遮；
translation: If he leaves one egg, it is a pārājika.

source_sentence: 若去兩卵，應滅擯。
translation: If he leaves these two eggs, he'll extinguish the gnats.

source_sentence: 若為惡獸嚙，若怨家所害，及自爛壞，不復能男，皆應滅擯。」
translation: If they're caught by a bad animal, harmed by an enemy, or destroyed by themselves, they won't be able to give birth again, and they'll all cease sexual desire.

source_sentence: 時諸比丘度被截手脚人為受具足戒，諸居士見，譏訶言：「沙門釋子無可度、不可度！
translation: When the monks were liberated by cutting off their hands and feet for the sake of receiving the full set of precepts, the householders saw them and ridiculed them, saying, There's nothing that the ascetic or Śākyamuni can save or cannot save!

source_sentence: 無沙門行！
translation: There's no ascetic practice!

source_sentence: 破沙門法！」
translation: break the ascetic's teaching!

source_sentence: 諸長老比丘聞，以是白佛。
translation: When the elder monks heard this, they reported it to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 佛言：「不應度此等人！
translation: The Buddha said, You shouldn't save these people!

source_sentence: 若度，得名受具足戒；
translation: If they are liberated, they receive the name of having received the full ordination.

source_sentence: 師僧，突吉羅。
translation: A teacher and a monk, a tukhila.

source_sentence: 從今截手、截脚、截手脚、截耳、截鼻、截耳鼻、截指、截男根頭、挑眼出、得鞭壞好相、遭官罪、攣躄、失聲、內外癭身、內曲身、外曲身、內外曲、睞眼、一臂偏長、一臂偏短、左手作、啞、聾、盲、乾痟病、癲狂、極老、無威儀、極醜，
translation: From now on, they will cut off their hands, legs, hands and feet, mutilate their ears, mutilate their nose, mutilate their ears and nose, mutilate their nose, mutilate their ears and nose, mutilate their fingers, mutilate their male faculties, pull out the eye so that it comes out, whi

source_sentence: 毀辱眾僧者，如是比皆不得度。」
translation: Those who disparage the saṃgha won't be able to save them in this way.

source_sentence: 若已度得名受具足戒，如上說。
translation: If someone has been liberated, they're called receiving the full set of precepts as explained above.

source_sentence: 諸比丘度吃人，佛言：「不應度吃人與受具足戒。」
translation: When the monks offered food to those who ate, the Buddha said, You shouldn't offer food to those who ate and receive the full set of precepts.

source_sentence: 復有諸比丘不先與受沙彌戒，便與受具足戒；
translation: Again, some monks were not previously given the precepts to be undertaken by a novice. They were then given the full set of precepts.

source_sentence: 復有諸比丘不請和尚，便與受具足戒；
translation: Again, some of the monks did not invite the bhikṣus and gave them the full set of precepts.

source_sentence: 復有諸比丘不乞受具足戒，便與受具足戒；
translation: Again, if some monks do not beg to receive the full set of precepts, they will be given the full set of precepts.

source_sentence: 復有諸比丘與裸形人受具足戒；
translation: Again, some bhikṣus received the full set of precepts together with naked people.

source_sentence: 復有諸比丘與不具衣鉢人受具足戒。
translation: Again, there are monks who receive the full set of precepts with people who don't have robes and bowls.

source_sentence: 以是白佛，佛言：「皆不應爾！」
translation: He therefore said this to the Buddha, who said, They shouldn't do so!

source_sentence: 時有一比丘借他衣鉢受具足戒，受具足戒已，諸比丘語：「汝著衣持鉢，
translation: One time, a monk borrowed another’s robe and bowl to receive the full set of precepts. Having received the full set of precepts, the monks said:

source_sentence: 共行乞食。」
translation: Together, we'll go begging for food.

source_sentence: 答言：「我無衣鉢。」
translation: He replied, I don't have a robe or bowl.

source_sentence: 諸比丘言：「佛不制無衣鉢，不得受具足戒耶？」
translation: The monks said, Didn't the Buddha prescribe no robes or bowls for those who won't be allowed to receive the full set of precepts?

source_sentence: 答言：「佛制！
translation: He replied, Buddha-tathāgata!

source_sentence: 我借他衣鉢受。」
translation: I'll borrow another person's robe and bowl to accept it.

source_sentence: 諸比丘不知云何？
translation: The monks didn't know what it was.

source_sentence: 以是白佛。
translation: That's why he said to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 佛以是事集比丘僧，告諸比丘：「聽將欲受戒者著戒壇外，眼見耳不聞語處，
translation: Because of this, the Buddha gathered the monks and said to the bhikṣus: Those who are about to receive the precepts should be allowed to stand outside the ordination platform. Their eyes will see it but their ears won’t hear it.

source_sentence: 請十眾在戒壇上。
translation: He invited the ten members of the congregation to sit on the precepts altar.

source_sentence: 和尚應語羯磨師：『長老！
translation: The monk should say to the karma master, 'Elder!

source_sentence: 今作羯磨。』
translation: Now, I'll perform the karma.'

source_sentence: 復應語教師：『長老！
translation: Again, you should say to the teacher, 'Elder!

source_sentence: 今受羯磨。』
translation: Now, I'll accept the karma.'

source_sentence: 羯磨師應如是白僧：『大德僧聽！
translation: The karma master should thus tell the saṃgha, 'Listen, great virtuous monks!'

source_sentence: 某甲，求某甲受具足戒，某甲作教師。
translation: A certain person asks a certain person to receive the full set of precepts, and a certain person becomes a teacher.

source_sentence: 若僧時到僧忍聽。
translation: If the saṃgha arrives at the saṃgha's time, the saṃgha will tolerate listening.

source_sentence: 白如是。』
translation: He said, 'So it is.'

source_sentence: 「教師應從坐起，至和尚前，問言：『已度此人未？』
translation: The teacher should rise from his seat and go to the monk in front of him, asking, 'Has this person been liberated?'

source_sentence: 若言未度，應語言先度之；

source_sentence: 佛言：「若未制前得名受具足戒，制後不名受具足戒。」
translation: The Buddha said, If someone hasn't received the full set of precepts before being disciplined, they'll be called receiving the full set of precepts and won't receive them after being disciplined.

translation: It was then that Śāriputra, Mahāmaudgalyāyana, Mahākātyāyana, Anuruddha, Pūrṇa Maitrāyaṇīputra, Rāhula, Ānanda, and Nanda.

translation: These great arhats approached the World-honored One, bowed their foreheads at his feet, and withdrew to sit at one side. They all sounded the same as Upāli’s questioning the Buddha:

source_sentence: 佛答亦如上。
translation: The Buddha's answer is likewise as above.

translation: At that time, the monks were seated without rising or falling and did not venerate one another. On seeing each other, the householders criticized them, saying: These śramaṇas do not know whether they are seated higher, middle, or lower.

translation: When the elder monks heard this, they reprimanded him in various ways and reported it to the Buddha.

translation: Because of this, the Buddha gathered the monks and asked the monks, Is that true?

translation: After the Buddha had reprimanded them in various ways, he asked the monks, Who should accept the first seat, the first gift, and the first veneration?

source_sentence: 諸比丘或言：「剎利、婆羅門、長者、居士、出家者應受。」
translation: Some monks may say, That should be accepted by the kṣatriyas, brāhmaṇas, elders, householders, and renunciants.

source_sentence: 或言：「誦毘尼、法師、阿練若、行十二頭陀，乃至得阿羅漢者，應受。」
translation: Or they may say, Recite the twelve ascetics who recite the vinaya, the teacher of the Dharma, the ārajñāpāramitā, and practice 12 ascetics, up to the point where they attain arhatship, should accept them.

source_sentence: 佛言：「不應爾！」
translation: The Buddha said, You shouldn't!

source_sentence: 諸比丘白佛：「若不爾，誰應受？」
translation: The monks said to the Buddha, If that's not the case, who should accept it?

source_sentence: 佛言：「過去世時，海邊有尼拘律樹，覆五百乘車。
translation: The Buddha said, In a past life, there was a nyagrodha tree by the seashore that covered five hundred chariots.

source_sentence: 時有三獸住彼樹下：一者雉、二者獼猴、三者象。
translation: At the time, there were three animals standing under that tree: one, a pheasant, two, a rhesus monkey, and three, an elephant.

source_sentence: 雖為親友，而不相推敬，後作是議：『我等既為親友，如何不相推敬？
translation: Even though they are friends and relatives, they don't esteem each other. Later, they say, 'Since we are friends and relatives, why don't we esteem each other?'

source_sentence: 應計年長者為尊，少者為卑。』
translation: You should consider the elders of old age to be superior and the younger to be inferior.'

source_sentence: 議已，問象：『汝憶何久遠事？』
translation: After the discussion, he asked the elephant, 'Remember what happened long ago?'

source_sentence: 象言：『我憶此樹至我腹時。』
translation: The elephant said, 'I remember the time when this tree reached my belly.'

source_sentence: 復問獼猴，獼猴言：『憶我平立，嚙此樹頭時。』
translation: Again, he asked the monkey, and the monkey said, 'Remember when I stood upright and touched the top of this tree.'

source_sentence: 復問雉，雉言：『我憶昔於某處食此樹子，來此吐核，遂生此樹。』
translation: Again, he asked the pheasant, and the pheasant said, 'I recall that in the past, I ate this tree fruit at a certain place and came here to spit out its kernel so that this tree would grow.'

source_sentence: 於是推雉為上，獼猴處中，象為下焉。
translation: The pheasant was the best, while the rhesus monkey was in the middle and the elephant was the lowest.

source_sentence: 若欲行時，獼猴負雉，象負獼猴。
translation: When he wants to go, the monkey carries the pheasant and the elephant carries the monkey.

source_sentence: 雉教二獸行十善業，皆共受行。
translation: The pheasant taught the two animals to perform the ten good actions, and they all accepted them together.

source_sentence: 世人聞之，皆受其化，遂名行善為雉梵行。
translation: The people of the world heard about it and all accepted its teaching, so they called it the practice of goodness as the religious practice of the pheasant.

source_sentence: 行其法者，命終生天。
translation: Those who practice this teaching will be born in heaven at the end of their life.

translation: Even animals still know there's superiority and inferiority, so why wouldn't they venerate each other if they didn't respect the right teaching?

translation: From now on, you who previously received the full set of precepts should accept the first seat, the first offering, the first reverence, and the first veneration, and thus practice it.
